title: 113_hr3529
content: The Act may be cited as the "Protecting Habitat Homeownership Act" and includes exemptions. The Truth in Lending Act is amended to include provisions for any fixed rate or residential mortgage loan originated by a non-profit low-income housing provider. A non-profit low-income housing provider is defined as an organization meeting specific criteria. A housing provider, exempt from taxation under section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code, offers residential mortgage loans at interest rates lower than the bank prime loan rate to promote homeownership for disadvantaged individuals or families. The housing provider, exempt from taxation under section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code, offers residential mortgage loans at interest rates lower than the bank prime loan rate to promote homeownership for disadvantaged individuals or families. The provider must not engage in the business of a loan originator or mortgage broker and must conduct its activities in a manner that serves public or charitable purposes. The curr_chunk discusses the requirements for a non-profit low-income housing provider to be exempt from certain regulations regarding residential mortgage loans. This includes serving public or charitable purposes, receiving funding in a non-incentivizing manner, compensating employees to act in the best interests of clients, and meeting other appropriate requirements determined by the Bureau. The curr_chunk discusses exemptions for non-profit low-income housing providers from certain regulations on residential mortgage loans under various sections of the law. Exemption for non-profit low-income housing providers from regulations on residential mortgage loans.
